data:
Based on the provided information, I will identify the core functionalities of the product and then list the features that fall outside these core functionalities.

**Core functionalities:**

1. Education platform to educate workers on Occupational Risk Prevention (ORP)
2. AI-powered training platform to guide users through learning about ORP
3. Interactive and personalized learning experience

**Features that fall outside these core functionalities:**

• **Chat for resolving doubts**: This feature is not directly related to the core functionalities of the product, as it is a support tool for users rather than a core feature of the training platform.
• **Link to certification pages**: This feature is not essential to the core functionalities of the product, as it is a peripheral feature that provides additional information to users.
• **Generate content from updated sources**: This feature is not a core functionality, as it is a tool for generating content rather than a feature that enables the core functionalities of the product.
• **Evaluate learning outcomes**: This feature is not a core functionality, as it is a tool for assessing the effectiveness of the training rather than a feature that enables the core functionalities of the product.
• **Report generation**: This feature is not a core functionality, as it is a tool for generating reports rather than a feature that enables the core functionalities of the product.
• **Contents annotation**: This feature is not a core functionality, as it is a tool for annotating content rather than a feature that enables the core functionalities of the product.
• **Complement content with verified sources**: This feature is not a core functionality, as it is a tool for verifying the accuracy of content rather than a feature that enables the core functionalities of the product.
• **Organize information by topics/chapters**: This feature is not a core functionality, as it is a tool for organizing content rather than a feature that enables the core functionalities of the product.
• **Include corporate content**: This feature is not a core functionality, as it is a tool for including company-specific content rather than a feature that enables the core functionalities of the product.
• **Assign training to workers**: This feature is not a core functionality, as it is a tool for assigning training to users rather than a feature that enables the core functionalities of the product.
• **User profile management**: This feature is not a core functionality, as it is a tool for managing user profiles rather than a feature that enables the core functionalities of the product.
• **AWS**: This is an architecture feature, not a core functionality.
• **PDF Editor**: This is an architecture feature, not a core functionality.
• **Jira**: This is an architecture feature, not a core functionality.
• **Email**: This is an architecture feature, not a core functionality.
• **Github**: This is an architecture feature, not a core functionality.
• **Cloud Computing**: This is an architecture feature, not a core functionality.
• **pgVector**: This is an architecture feature, not a core functionality.
• **CI/CD**: This is an architecture feature, not a core functionality.
• **Autoscaling Groups**: This is an architecture feature, not a core functionality.
• **Code Builder**: This is an architecture feature, not a core functionality.
• **Web Platform**: This is an architecture feature, not a core functionality.
• **Secrets Management**: This is an architecture feature, not a core functionality.
• **Python**: This is an architecture feature, not a core functionality.
• **REST API**: This is an architecture feature, not a core functionality.
• **UI/UX**: This is an architecture feature, not a core functionality.
• **React**: This is an architecture feature, not a core functionality.
• **Figma**: This is an architecture feature, not a core functionality.
• **Scalability**: This is an architecture feature, not a core functionality.
• **GPT**: This is an architecture feature, not a core functionality.
• **Unfriendly interfaces**: This is a risk, not a core functionality.
• **Lack of feedback**: This is a risk, not a core functionality.
• **Poor prioritization of functionalities**: This is a risk, not a core functionality.
• **Low visibility on social media**: This is a risk, not a core functionality.
• **Difficulty in measuring training quality**: This is a risk, not a core functionality.
• **AI use regulations**: This is a risk, not a core functionality.

Note that some features, such as the chat for resolving doubts, may be useful for the product, but they are not essential to the core functionalities of the product.
